intro: Caralluma nilagiriana, commonly known as the Nilagiri devil's backbone, is a succulent plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its spiny, branching stems and small, paddle-shaped leaves. The plant is adapted to arid and rocky environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
